div.head: Keyword Search Tips
div.p: The Keyword Repository allows users to search for keywords that have been assigned to items within ncse using a combination of controlled and free-text entry fields. This section describes how to enter search terms and refine search queries, and how to interpret and refine search results.
This section does not describe how to search the full-text appearing within fascimiles. For this information, please read: Advanced Search Tips in the fascimile repository.

div.head: Free-text Entry Search Fields
div.p: Persons, places and institutions can be entered by selecting the entity type from the drop down menu of the corresponding field, and then keying in text (See example below). Multi-word terms may be entered in full (e.g. John Smith), or in a partial form (e.g. Smith).

Subject and Image descriptors are entered by selecting a controlled vocabulary from the drop down menu, and then selecting terms from the corresponding thesaurus, reached by clicking the thesaurus icon: [insert icon] next to the input field.

div.head: Multiple Terms in One Search Box
div.p: Multiple terms typed into one search box are automatically interpreted as a Boolean AND. If conducting a Boolean search using different operators (e.g. OR, NOT), enter terms into separate search boxes

div.head: Approximate Match Searching
div.p: By default, queries using the free-text fields are compared to the keyword index based on an exact match match to the terms entered- the user can select from the similarity dropdown list, or take the default value, 90%. Selecting a lower percentage will increase the number of results returned, because the search engine will count 'fuzzier' or less exact matches as hits.

div.head: Wildcard/Stemming
div.p: If the user enters a term with a wildcard, the term will be searched as a wildcard query. To perform a single character wildcard search use the "?" symbol. To perform a multiple character wildcard search use the "*" symbol. The single character wildcard search looks for terms that match that with the single character replaced. For example, to search for "text" or "test" you can use the search: te?t
Multiple character wildcard searches looks for 0 or more characters. For example, to search for test, tests or tester, you can use the search: test*
You can also use the wildcard searches in the middle of a term: te*t But, you cannot use a * or ? symbol as the first character of a search.

div.head: Combined Searches
div.p: A user may enter a term with a wildcard AND a term without into a single search field; these will be treated as separate queries (the term with operators as a wildcard query, and the one without as a "fuzzy" search).

div.head: Search Results
div.p: Users may refine a result set by selecting a semantic qualifier (names, persons, places, institutions, semantic tags, image metadata). Once selected, this term is added to the query as a boolean AND.
Filters may be removed by clicking the 'remove' link next to a filter.

div.head: Browsing Tips
div.p: Users may browse the controlled vocabularies for two keyword types: semantic tags, and image descriptors.
